subject: Re: New File
author: ecuyler
full_text:
Thank you for the help Juli.  I'll be sure to use your log sheet.  I
do like their response to you telling them about the recorder. 

I've gotten a couple of smart ass responses to questions I've asked. 
I had my wife listen to them and she says it sounds like I'm answering
myself.  It's nice to know there is some sort of personality on the
other side.

Jeremy












--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...>
wrote:
>
> Jeremy 
>               I have posted a log sheet if you want to use it in the
file section. This may also help in aiding you with your sessions. 
Just remember once your rock n rolling your questions along with their
responses just may lead you in a direction you may never intended.  Be
quick on your feet, but try to preplan if you can.
>    
>              Also, I always try and ask them if they have any
questions for me or if I can deliver a message of any kind.  I never
want them to think that its all about me and getting the information I
WANT!  You would never have a conversation with a live friend always
taking over the topic.  For if that was the case I would not have any
friends, LOL.  
>    
>             You may also get communication for only you to hear, in
which case you may discover that your recorder has been turned off.  I
have attached a clip where I tell them to stop shutting up my recorder
and their response is sarcastic as if they had no clue to what I was
talking about.  I love their sense of humor!
> 
>    
>   Juli
> ecuyler <ecuyler@...> wrote:
>           I totally agree. I'll be honest, I did just wing it on
yesterdays
> session. In the previous sessions I did remember to write down the
> questions I wanted to ask ahead of time. 
> 
> Jeremy
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday
> <paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > Jeremy,
> > 
> > Juli is right, it is very helpfull to have your questions thought
> out before a session especially if the session is pertaining to a
> certain topic.
> > 
> > If you wing it, like juli said you will tend to speed up and overlap
> the next question with the previous answer and then you think you did 
> > not recieve a response so you ask the same question again. I had
> this happen a few day's ago and when I repeated the question my tech's
> > mike and lisa both said "AGAIN" they start to lose patience
> sometimes, but you have to remember to them we must be like dealing
> with kindergarten children.
> > 
> > Bruce
> > Bruce Halliday 
> > 
> > 
> > To: EVP-ITC@: ghostchasingfool@: Thu, 31 Jan 2008 15:18:30
> -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New File
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > Jeremy:
> > You may also want to try and ask the questions
> quickly (I often times write them down prior to a session). The
> reason being I have noticed that many people drag the questions or ask
> more than one question prior to getting a response. Please note that
> in my research I have on occasion spoken over them and get not the
> immediate response because I was too busy talking. I have even gotten
> from my tec David to ("I'm Talking) which was funny cause anyone that
> knows me, knows I love to gab, lol. I have attached to clips so you
> can see what I am talking about. The first one David tells me that
> basicly I needed to listen and not speak, for he was not done. The
> second, Joel is asking a questions and the question seems to go on and
> on, only to have David say "Joel Speak Up".
> > 
> > In addition, I have also gotten as many as 3
> spirits responding to your question at the same time. I believe Bruce
> and Steve have experienced that on more than one occasion. Maybe they
> could post or attach one of these files for an example. 
> > 
> > They know whats going on, and they will comply
> with you and guide you along the way. Best of Luck and Great
> Job!ecuyler <ecuyler@> wrote:
> > 
> > 
> > Sorry Bruce. I was so excited, I got carried away. When I'm
> excited,I have a totally different thought pattern. I do understand
> what you are saying though about doing it one questionat a time. I'll
> be sure to do that from now on. Thanks for the help.Jeremy--- In
> EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday<paranormalinvestigating@>
> wrote:>> > Jeremy,> > There are quite a few answer or messages just in
> this clip.> My suggestion is to go over the clip a question at a
> time.> > Put the whole recording into your editer and go to the
> beginning> of a question and then save the question and the preceeding
> signalup to the next question.> In a file of it's own. Go over the
> recorded data following thesingle question and look for specific
> answers.> to that question. If there are any save that answer to a new
> file inthe editer and slow it or clean it a bit so it is
> compehencible.> then paste it back where it belongs in the question
> file. You shouldnow have the question and answer in one file.> Save it
> and label it with the question and answer as one file.> > I hope you
> understand that explination, if not fire back somequestions and I'll
> try to clarify.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@: ecuyler@:
> Thu, 31 Jan 2008 02:46:17+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: New File> > > > >
> After listening again, I think the "tells me to" part is
> morethanlikely just a radio station.Jeremy--- In
> EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com,"ecuyler" <ecuyler@> wrote:>> Just posted a
> new file on Esnips. It'sfairly big in size so I went> ahead and put it
> on there to help savespace on here. This is
>
thelink:>http://www.esnips.com/doc/99a4a4b1-de10-40d8-943e-85b809a2332a/Session-4-01_30_08-20-125-govt>>
> I did as Bruce had asked and just used the RS 20-125 with a
> digital>recorder and this is what I came up with. It's a little over
> 30>seconds long. > > Bruce, if you still want to hear all of
> thissession, I will put it> all on Esnips. Just let me know. There
> isquite a bit more to it> than just this one clip. It's amazing all
> thethings that came through.> > Here's a little background on the
> file. Iasked two questions. The> first was, "Is the US governemnt
> using ITCresearch?" The second,> "How is the US goverment using ITC
> research?"I hear these things in> this order: "Yeah it is, just stop
> it, juststop, you need help," and> something toward the end that I
> can't quitemake out. Sounds like a> couple of words and then "tells me
> to." Letme know what you think.> > Jeremy> > > > > > > >
